meanings.definition: A person who talks rapidly and incessantly.
meanings.sent1: The chatterer in class never gives anyone else a chance to speak.
meanings.sent2: The little chatterer in the group kept everyone entertained with their stories.
meanings.sent3: The chatterer at the party had everyone laughing with their jokes.
meanings.sent4: The busy marketplace was filled with the chatter of the vendors, each one trying to outsell the other.
meanings.sent5: The chatterer's voice was like a constant stream of words, never pausing for a breath.

meanings.sent1: She would chatterer on about her day without noticing if anyone was listening.
meanings.sent2: The children would chatterer excitedly about their upcoming trip to the zoo.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seemed to chatterer back and forth in their own language.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the rain on the roof seemed to chatterer throughout the night.
meanings.sent5: The old radio would chatterer on in the background, filling the room with staticky noise.
